description:
This box of Kraft macaroni and cheese dinner may look simple, but it actually contains some extraordinary things. Inside you'll find our delicious elbow macaroni waiting to be covered with gooey, cheesy goodness. And now, there are a few things you won't find.

Directions
Classic Prep: 6 cups water; 4 tbsp margarine or butter; 1/4 cup milk. Cooking Instructions: 1. Boil water in medium saucepan. Stir in macaroni; cook 7 to 8 min or until tender, stirring occasionally. 2. Drain. Do not rinse. Return to pan. 3. Add margarine or butter, milk and cheese sauce mix; mix well. To Prepare with Less Fat: Prepare as directed, using 2 tbsp margarine or butter and 1/4 cup fat-free milk.
title: Kraft Macaroni & Cheese Dinner Original 7.25 oz

description:
Directions
Best when used by date on bottom. 1. Remove lid and cheese sauce mix; set aside. (Note: You will see loose white powder in pasta. This is necessary for proper cooking). Add water to fill line in cup. Stir. 2. Warning: Help prevent risk of fire - add water to fill line. Do not leave microwave unattended. 3. Microwave, uncovered, on high 3-1/2 min or until pasta is tender. Do not drain. (Excess liquid is needed to make cheese sauce). Stir in cheese sauce mix until well blended. (Cheese sauce will thicken upon standing). Do not reuse cup.

description:
Perfect every time. Uncle Ben's Ready Rice Whole Grain Brown makes it easy to support a well-balanced diet. Cooks in 90 seconds.

Directions
Microwave in the pouch.
1. Squeeze pouch to separate rice.
2. Tear two inches to vent.
3. Heat on high for 90 seconds.
4. Remove from microwave using cool touch area on untorn side. Caution: Steam from pouch will be hot. Cooking time for 2 pouches - 2-1/2 minutes. Microwave times may vary. Take when handling and opening the hot pouch. Refrigerate unused portion.

In the Skillet:
1. Gently squeeze the sides of the pouch to break apart the rice and pour contents into a skillet.
2. Add 2 tbsp of water and heat.
3. Stir rice occasionally until heated thoroughly.
4. Serve immediately.
title: Uncle Ben's® Whole Grain Brown Ready Rice - 8.8oz

Directions
You will need 3 tablespoon cold water and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil.

Stove top
1. Pour Pasta into 3-quart saucepan 3/4 full of boiling water. Gently boil uncovered 12 minutes, stirring occasionally. (For more tender pasta, boil 1 to 2 minutes longer). 2. Stir together Seasoning, cold water and oil in medium bowl. Set aside. 3. Drain pasta. Rinse with cold water; drain well. Stir pasta into seasoning mixture (add chopped tomato if desired). Serve immediately, or refrigerate. (If desired, stir in a few teaspoons more oil to moisten refrigerated salad). Refrigerate leftovers.

Microwave Directions:
Fill 2-1/4 quart microwavable casserole dish (with handles) with 4 cups water. Pour Pasta into water; stir. Microwave uncovered on high 12 to 15 minutes until pasta is tender (microwave times may vary). Caution: Dish and pasta will be very hot! Continue as directed in steps 2 and 3 above.

Directions
Stove top:

2. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender.
3. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving.

Microwave:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups hot water, Rice Mix, meat of your choice (Add cooked shrimp during last 5 minutes of cooking time.) and 1 tbsp. vegetable or olive oil (optional) in 2-1/2-quart microwavable bowl until well blended. Cover.
2. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir. Microwave on medium (50% power) 18 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand in microwave 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. description:
Minute Ready to Serve Rice is delicious, convenient and perfectly portioned; and it's ready in just 60 seconds. Fully cooked, nothing to add. Great for quick and easy meals at work or home.

Directions:

Measurements:
2 Servings: 1 cup rice, 1 cup water;
4 Servings: 2 cups rice, 1-3/4 cups water;
6 Servings: 3 cups rice, 2-1/2 cups water;
8 Servings: 4 cups rice, 3 cups water. 1/2 cup uncooked rice = 1 serving (about 2/3 cup cooked rice).

Saucepan:
1. Bring water to a boil (If desired, add butter and salt to taste.). 2. Stir in rice; return to boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes. 3. Remove from heat and stir; cover. Let stand 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork.

Microwave:
1. Place water and rice in microwave-safe bowl (If desired, add butter and salt to taste.) 2. Cover and microwave on high. Microwave Cook Times: 2 Servings, 7 minutes; 4 servings, 9 minutes; 6 servings, 12 minutes. 3. Let stand 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Microwave ovens vary. Cooking times are approximate.

description:
Enjoy the creamy taste of these seasoned potatoes with naturally flavored bacon, cheese, chives & sour cream.

Directions:
You Will Need for 1 Pouch (4 servings): 1-1/3 cups water; 2-1/2 tablespoons butter or margarine; 1/2 cup milk.

Stove top: Heat water and butter to a rapid boil in 2-quart saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in milk and 1 pouch potatoes with seasoning just until well blended. Let stand about 1 minute or until liquid is absorbed; whip vigorously with fork until smooth.
Refrigerate leftovers.
Tips: For stiffer potatoes, let stand 3 to 5 minutes. For extra-creamy potatoes, stir in more milk, 1 tablespoon at a time.

Microwave: 1. Stir 1-1/3 cups hot water, 1/2 cup milk, 2-1/2 tablespoons butter or margarine and 1 pouch potatoes with seasoning in 1-1/2-quart microwavable casserole or bowl until moistened. 2. Cover with microwavable plastic wrap, folding back one side to vent steam. Microwave on High 2 to 3 minutes or until hot. Remove carefully from microwave - bowl and potatoes will be hot; whip with fork until smooth.
Refrigerate leftovers. For 2 Pouches (8 servings): Double all ingredients. For Stove-Top, use 3-quart saucepan. For Microwave, use 2-quart microwavable casserole or bowl; microwave on High 3 to 4 minutes or until hot.
High Altitude: Because liquids may evaporate faster, increase water amount and cook times if needed.

3. Cut open bag and pour contents into a serving dish. Add 1 tsp butter (optional). Fluff with fork and serve. Microwave ovens vary. Cooking times are approximate. Adjust cooking time as needed. For Best Results: For firmer rice, reduce cooking time. For softer rice, increase cooking time.

description: Meet Bernie! Bernie was Annie's pet Dutch rabbit. When she started the company, Annie chose him to be our official "rabbit of approval" representing the simplicity, care, and goodness in all of our products.  Dear Friend, My husband Rob and I were the Annie's Consumer Relations and Mail Order team for several years and were accustomed to the phone ringing day and night. If the phone rang at 2:00 AM, it might have been a friend or family member, but more likely it was someone calling to order mac & cheese. Annie's original warehouse was an old grain mill without climate control. Rob and I hand-addressed every mail-ordered case, and during the winter months I often used a hair dryer to keep my fingers nimble. We packed our two-door Volkswagen with up to 50 cases, keeping our tiny post office busy. My connection to our consumers deepened with every case sent during those years; a connection, I believe, is the foundation of Annie's. Bye for now, Annie.  We work with trusted suppliers to source only non-GMO ingredients.  Family Farms...grow the organic wheat and raise the organic cows to make flour for our macaroni and to produce milk for our cheese to make your meal wonderfully wholesome & delicious!

description:
These potatoes come in a rich, creamy cheese sauce. Tastes as good as homemade!

Direction:
You Will Need: 2 cups boiling water; 1/2 cup milk; 2 tablespoons margarine or butter.
Oven:
1. Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Stir potatoes, sauce mix, boiling water, milk and margarine in 1-1/2-quart casserole. 2. Bake uncovered about 20 minutes or until tender (sauce will thicken as it stands). Refrigerate leftovers. Baking Tips: For 2 boxes, double all ingredients; bake in 3-qt casserole about 25 min. Bake potatoes and roast meat at same time: 325 degrees F about 55 min; 350 degrees F about 45 min; 375 degrees F about 40 min.

Stove-Top:
1. Heat potatoes, sauce mix, 2 cups hot water, 1/2 cup milk and 2 tablespoons margarine or butter just to a boil in 2-quart saucepan, stirring occasionally (watch carefully to avoid boil over). 2. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender (sauce will thicken as it stands). description:
These authentic rice noodles are essential to Thai cooking. Prepare them with chicken, beef, seafood or vegetables. For extra flavor combine with your favorite Thai sauce. Enjoy! In Soups and Stews, use leftover noodles in your favorite soups and stews. Just add prior to serving. Warm through. Enjoy!

Directions:

Stir-Fry or Sauté:
1. Pour noodles into a bowl. 2. Cover with very hot tap water. Stir to separate. Soak noodles for 25-30 minutes. Do not over soak. 3. Drain noodles. 4. Stir-fry noodles with your favorite ingredients until firm yet tender (al dente) and heated through, about 4-6 minutes. Enjoy!

As Pasta:
1. Add noodles to 4 quarts salted boiling water. Stir to separate, boil until tender yet still firm (al dente), about 4-6 minutes. 2. Immediately drain cooked noodles. Quickly rinse under cold water and drain again. 3. Add your favorite sauce. Serve immediately.

description:
Chef Boyardee Pizza Kits are the perfect start to great-tasting homemade pizza. Add your favorite cheeses, meats & vegetables to create pizzas your family will love.

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degree F. Pour crust mix from both pouches (or prepare 1 crust with 1 pouch and 2/3 cup very warm water. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon oil, and follow steps 2-4 on single pizza pan or cookie sheet) into a medium bowl. Stir in 1-1/3 cups very warm water with fork; mix until completely moistened and dough forms into a loose ball. Drizzle 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over dough. Turn to coat entire surface with oil. Cover loosely with plastic wrap; let stand in a warm place for 5 minutes (may increase stand time to 20 minutes for a more pliable dough and lighter baked crust). 2. Spray two 12-in pizza pans - or - two cookie sheets with no stick cooking spray (May substitute a light coating of vegetable oil for cooking spray). Divide dough in half placing each piece in the center of selected pans. For pizza pan - using hands, spread dough to edge; pinch edge to contain sauce. Repeat with other pan. For cookie sheet - using hands, shape dough into a 14 in x 10 in rectangle; pinch edge to contain sauce. Repeat with other pan. 3. Spread half of pizza sauce evenly on each piece of dough to within 1/2 inch of edge. Open cheese pouch; sprinkle evenly over sauce. Personalize pizza by adding favorite toppings - cheese, vegetables or other cooked meat, if desired. 4. Place prepared pizzas on the lowest two racks in oven. Bake for 10 minutes; rotate pans in oven. Bake for another 10 - 12 minutes or until crust in golden brown. For a Thick Crust Pizza: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Spray 13 x 9-inch glass baking pan with no-stick cooking spray. Using hands, spread dough into bottom of pan. Spread sauce evenly over crust. Top with cheese. Bake for 22-24 minutes or until bottom crust is golden brown.

Directions:

Microwave:
Keep box open in microwave.
1. Remove all envelopes from carton. Add 1 cup water to carton (to inside fill line). 2. Except for peanuts, add contents of all envelopes to carton, starting with sauce. 3. Leave carton open, microwave on high for 3 minutes. Remove carton carefully (hot). Stir in noodles. 4. Leave carton open, microwave for 1 more minute. Close carton, let rest 1 minute. (If noodles are too firm, cook for 1 more minute.) Add peanuts, enjoy! Microwaves may vary. Heating times are approximate. Caution: Contents hot after microwaving!

Stove top:
1. Add 1 cup water to saucepan. 2. Add contents of all envelopes, except peanuts. 3. While stirring, bring to a boil. Simmer 4 minutes or until noodles are soft. Add peanuts & serve! Add additional water as needed. Once cooked, do not reheat in box.

description:
This easy-to-prepare rice dish has just the right blend of ingredients for great-tasting, authentic New Orleans style meal.

Directions
Easy Stove Top:
1. In a two quart saucepan, combine 1-1/2 cups water, 15 oz can diced tomatoes (crushed), 1 tablespoon butter or margarine and Zatarain's Spanish Rice mix. Stir well and bring to boil.
2. Stir, reduce heat, cover and simmer over Low heat for 25 minutes or until all water is absorbed.
3. Remove from heat, let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff and serve.

Microwave:
1. In a 2-1/2 quart microwave- safe bowl, combine 1-1/2 cups hot water, 15 oz can crushed diced tomatoes, 1 tablespoon butter or margarine (optional) and Zatarain's Spanish Rice mix and stir thoroughly.
2. Cover and cook on High for 5 minutes, stir and reduce power to 60% and cook for approximately 16 minutes (Cook time may differ depending on the powder of the microwave oven), stirring occasionally.
3. Remove, stir and let stand covered for 5 minutes before serving.
title: Zatarain's® New Orleans Style Spanish Rice - 7.4oz
bullet_description: Type of Rice or Grain: rice blend

description:
When you want great flavor, jazz it up with Zatarain's! Long grain white rice and tender red beans, onions and bell peppers.

Directions
Stove Top:
1. Mix 3 cups water, Rice Mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-quart saucepan until well bended. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover.
2. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent rice and beans from sticking.
3. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Serving Suggestion: Add a half pound of sliced sausage to make a complete meal.

Microwave:
1. Mix 3 cups hot water, Rice Mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-1/2-quart microwavable bowl until well blended. Cover.
2. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir. Microwave on medium (50% power) 18 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand in microwave 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Microwave ovens vary; adjust cooking times as needed. Cooking times are based on an 1100 watt microwave oven. Caution: Bowl and contents will be very hot. Use pot holders when removing from microwave.
title: Zatarain's® New Orleans Style Original Red Beans and Rice - 8oz

description:
When you want great flavor, jazz it up with Zatarain's! Long grain white rice and black beans seasoned with bell pepper, onion and garlic.

Directions
Stove Top Directions:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups water, rice mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-quart saucepan until well blended. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover.
2. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent rice and beans from sticking.
3. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Serving Suggestion: Add a half pound of sliced sausage to make a complete meal.

Microwave Directions:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups hot water, rice mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-1/2-quart microwavable bowl until well blended. Cover.
2. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir. Microwave on medium (50% power) 18 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand in microwave 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Microwave ovens vary; adjust cooking times as needed. Cooking times are based on an 1100 watt microwave oven. Caution: Bowl and contents will be very hot. Use pot holders when removing from microwave.
title: Zatarain's® New Orleans Style Black Beans and Rice - 7oz

description:
These potatoes have the perfect blend of cheeses for that delicious homemade taste every time.

Directions:
You Will Need: 2 cups boiling water; 1/2 cup milk; 2 tablespoons butter or margarine.

Oven:
1. Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Stir sauce mix, boiling water, milk and butter with whisk in 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Stir in potatoes. 2. Bake uncovered about 20 minutes or until top is golden brown and potatoes are tender (sauce will thicken as it stands). Stir before serving. Refrigerate leftovers.
Baking Tips: For 2 boxes, double all ingredients; bake in 3-quart casserole dish about 25 minutes. Bake potatoes and roast meat at same time: 325 degrees F about 55 minutes; 350 degrees F about 45 minutes; 375 degrees F about 40 minutes.

Stove-Top:
1. Stir sauce mix, 2-1/4 cups hot water, 1/2 cup milk, 2 tablespoons butter or margarine and potatoes in 2-quart saucepan. Heat just to boiling, stirring occasionally. Watch carefully to avoid boilover. 2. Reduce heat; cover and simmer about 15 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender (sauce will thicken as it stands). Refrigerate leftovers.

Microwave:

description:
Keep it tasty, simple and satisfying. Serve with steamed rice.

Recipe Guide: Simply Add: 2 tbsp canola or vegetable oil; 1 lb thinly sliced boneless chicken breast or thighs, pork fillet or whole peeled shrimp; 1 egg, lightly beaten; 4 scallions, white and green parts finely sliced; juice of 1 lemon.

Directions
Step 1: Place Rice Stick Noodles in a large heat-safe bowl and cover with boiling water. Use a fork to stir and separate noodles. Leave to soak for 5-10 minutes or until softened. Drain noodles and rinse with cold water. Set aside for later. Step 2: In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over high heat. Add meat or shrimp and cook for 2-5 minutes or until cooked through. Push everything to one side of the pan or wok and add egg to the empty side. Let egg set for a minute until it starts to firm up. Now break up the egg and mix it through the meat/shrimp. Add softened rice stick noodles and Pad Thai Sauce into the pan. Use tongs to mix the whole lot together until well combined. Remove from heat and toss in the scallions and lemon juice. Enjoy! Marion's Meal Idea: Serve my Pad Thai as part of a traditional Thai banquet for 4, along with other dishes such as a curry, stir fry and/or Thai salad.
title: Marion's Kitchen Pad Thai 15.2-oz.

Direction:
You Will Need for 1 Pouch (4 Servings): 1-1/2 cups water; 2 tablespoons butter or margarine; 1/2 cup milk.

Microwave:

description:
Pad Thai is the classic Thai noodle dish with sweet and tangy notes of tamarind and garlic. Its complex and pleasing flavors make it one of the world's most famous Thai noodle dishes. Now with Thai Kitchen Pad Thai Noodle Kit, you can prepare this popular noodle dish quickly and easily in your own kitchen.

Directions
Prep Time: 10 minutes. Cook Time: 20 minutes. Makes about 3 (1-cup) servings. 1 pouch stir-fry rice noodles; 1 pouch Pad Thai Sauce; 3 tbsp. vegetable oil, divided; 1 egg; 4 oz. cubed chicken breasts or peeled and deveined shrimp; 1/2 cup fresh bean sprouts; 1/4 cup crushed peanuts; lime wedges, fresh red chilies and cilantro (optional).

1. Bring 4 cups water to boil in medium saucepan. Remove from heat. Add rice noodles; let stand 6 to 8 minutes or until noodles are soft but firm. Drain. Rinse with cold water.
2. Heat 1 tbsp. of oil in wok or large skillet on medium heat. Add egg; cook and stir until scrambled. Remove from skillet. Heat remaining 2 tbsp. oil in skillet. Add chicken; stir fry 3 to 4 minutes or until cooked through. Add softened rice noodles and Pad Thai Sauce; stir fry 3 to 4 minutes until noodles are tender and sauce is absorbed into the noodles. (If noodles are too firm, add 1 tsp. water and continue to stir fry until tender.)
3. Stir in bean sprouts and scrambled egg. Sprinkle with peanuts. Garnish with lime wedges, chilies and cilantro, if desired.

description:
Wolff's kasha is a pleasant mealtime alternative to rice or potatoes. Wolff 's kasha is extremely versatile and can be served as an entree, side dish, stuffing, in soups and salads, appetizers, desserts and as a delicious breakfast cereal.

Directions
2 cups broth, bouillon, consomme or water. 2 tablespoons butter or margarine(low fat version: substitute 1 egg white for whole egg; eliminate butter or margarine). 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon salt(less salt may be required if using broth). 1/8 teaspoon pepper. 1 cup kasha. 1 egg (or egg white) (low fat version: substitute 1 egg white for whole egg; eliminate butter or margarine).

Stove top:
1. Heat liquid, butter and seasoning to boiling.
2. Lightly beat egg in bowl with fork. Add kasha; stir to coat kernels.
3. In separate medium-size skillet or saucepan, add egg-coated kasha. Cook over high heat 2 to 3 min., stirring constantly until egg has dried on kasha and kernels are separate. Reduce heat to low.
4. Quickly stir in boiling liquid. Cover tightly; simmer 7 to 10 min. Until kasha kernels are tender and liquid is absorbed. Makes about 4 cups.

Microwave method:
1. heat liquid to boiling.
2. Beat egg lightly with fork in 2 qt. Microwave-safe casserole. Add kasha; stir to coat kernels.
3. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 min. Stir frequently to separate kernels. Carefully stir in liquid and remaining ingredients. Microwave, covered, on high 5 to 7 min. Until kernels are tender and liquid is absorbed.
title: Wolff's® Kasha Combination Meal 13 oz

bullets: Contains no additives, fortifiers, or preservatives

description:
Soy Vay Rice & Seasoning Mix, Garlic Fried Rice, is bursting with distinct Asian flavor accents. The combination of carrots, peas and savory garlic with brown rice creates an amazing dish full of flavor. Add pork, beef or shrimp for a delicious meal the whole family will love. Or simply serve this preservative free, rice dish on the side of chicken, beef, pork or salmon steaks. The meal ideas are endless and the taste is great with Soy Vay.

Directions: Add rice and seasoning mix from the pouches to 2 1/2 cups of water in a 2-quart saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until water boils, stirring occasionally. Cook at a boil for 1 minute, reduce heat to medium-low and cover and simmer for 25 minutes. Continue to simmer, stirring occasionally until desired consistency is reached.

Ingredients: Long grain parboiled brown rice, maltodextrin, garlic*, carrot*, less than 2% of: peas*, onion*, spices, wheat, soybeans, ginger*, corn starch, salt, caramel color, yeast extract, natural flavor, calcium stearate, sugar, sesame oil. *Dried

Warnings: Contains wheat and soy. Refrigerate or discard leftovers within two hours of preparation. Product formulations, packaging and promotions may change. For the most current information refer to product packaging.
